intro: Convolvulus keniensis, commonly known as Kenyan morning glory, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that grows up to 1 meter in height, characterized by its slender, twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet, typically blooming in the morning. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
